media.caption: Title page of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Mapping the Gray Diary
text.text: Explore the landscapes and communities William Fairfax Gray recorded in his diary. This map visualizes his travels through 1830s Texas, linking his firsthand observations to the places where history unfolded.

media.caption: Vol. 1, Page 2 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, Octo. 6th, 1835
text.text: Left Fredericksburg, Virginia. Arrived in Orange, Virginia. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 1, Page 3 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Wednesday, Octo. 7, 1835.
text.text: Left Orange, passed Barboursville, Charlottesville, and Waynesburg, and arrived at Staunton, Virginia at around 8 o'clock. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 1, Page 3 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Thursday, Octo. 8, 1835.
text.text: Left Staunton, passed Warm Springs at around 4 o'clock, and passed the Hot Springs around sunset. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 1, Page 4 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Friday, Octo. 9, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in Lewisburg (now in West Virginia). Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 1, Page 5 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Saturday, Octo. 10, 1835.
text.text: Left Lewisburg, passed Hawksnest and Falls of Kenawha, reached Charleston (now in West Virginia) at around 9 o'clock. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 1, Page 6 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Sunday, Octo. 11th, 1835.
text.text: Left Charleston, arrived in Guyandotte at around 2 o'clock. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 1, Page 8 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Monday, Octo. 12, 1835.
text.text: Left Guyandotte on the steamboat Wave down the Ohio. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 1, Page 9 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, Octo. 13th, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in Portsmouth, Ohio, passed Vanceburg, Kentucky, and Manchester and Rockville, both in Ohio. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 1, Page 10 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Wednesday, Octo. 14, 1835.
text.text: Arrived at Cincinnati at night. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 1, Page 11 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Thursday, Octo. 15, 1835.
text.text: Left Cincinnati on the steamboat Algonquin, bound for New Orleans. Passed Lawrenceburg and Vevay, both in Indiana, Ghent, Kentucky, and Madison, Indiana. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 1, Page 11 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Friday, Octo. 16, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in Louisville, Kentucky. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 1, Page 13 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Saturday, Octo. 17, 1835.
text.text: Left Louisville on board the steamboat Patrick Henry. Passed Sleeping Port, Kentucky, New Albany, Indiana, West Point, Kentucky, Buck Creek, Northampton, and Indian Creek, all in Indiana, and Brandenburg, Kentucky. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 1, Page 14 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Sunday, Octo. 18, 1835.
text.text: Arrived at Owensboro, Kentucky. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 1, Page 15 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Monday, Octo. 19, 1835.
text.text: Visited Cave in Rock, near the border between Indiana and Illinois. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 2, Page 17 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, Octo. 20, 1835.
text.text: The Patrick Henry passed Cumberland Island and Paducah, Kentucky. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 2, Page 18 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Wednesday, Octo. 21, 1835.
text.text: Passed Mill's Point, Kentucky. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 2, Page 19 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Thursday, Octo. 22nd, 1835.
text.text: Passed Randolph and Memphis, both in Tennessee. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 2, Page 19 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Friday, Octo. 23rd, 1835.
text.text: Left Memphis and arrived in Helena, Arkansas. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 2, Page 21 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Saturday, Octo. 24th, 1835.
text.text: Remained in Helena another day because Gray's company did not board the next steamboat. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 2, Page 22 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Sunday, Octo. 25th, 1835.
text.text: Boarded the steamboat Superior. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 2, Page 22 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Monday, Octo. 26, 1835.
text.text: Arrived at Princeton, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

text.headline: Tuesday, Octo. 27, 1835.
text.text: Visited a mill on Lake Jackson and several plantations on Lake Washington in Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 2, Page 23 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Wednesday, Octo. 28, 1835.
text.text: Visited more plantations and returned to Princeton, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 2, Page 25 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Thursday, Octo. 29, 1835.
text.text: Arrived at Vicksburg, Mississippi at 10 o'clock. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 2, Page 27 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, Nov. 3, 1835.
text.text: Spent the day copying maps in Vicksburg. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 2, Page 28 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Thursday, Nov. 12, 1835.
text.text: Arrived at Clinton, Mississippi at about 4 o'clock. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 3, Page 34 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Jackson, Friday, Nov. 13th, 1835.
text.text: Arrived at Jackson, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 3, Page 35 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Clinton, Saturday, Nov. 14, 1835.
text.text: Returned to Clinton. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 3, Page 36 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Monday, Nov. 16, 1835.
text.text: Arrived at Vicksburg, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 3, Page 38 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Saturday, Nov. 21, 1835.
text.text: Arrived six miles from Manchester, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 3, Page 41 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Sunday, Nov. 22, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in Manchester, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 3, Page 43 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Monday, Dec. 7, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in Liverpool, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 3, Page 51 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, Dec. 8, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in Vicksburg, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 3, Page 52 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Monday, Dec. 21, 1835.
text.text: Left Vicksburg for Clinton. Arrived in Bridgeport, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 4, Page 55 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, Dec. 22, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in Clinton, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 4, Page 56 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Thursday, Dec. 24, 1835.
text.text: Left Clinton and returned to Vicksburg. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 4, Page 57 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Saturday, Dec. 26, 1835.
text.text: Boarded the steamboat Chancellor and arrived in Warrenton, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 4, Page 57 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Sunday, Dec. 27, 1835.
text.text: Arrived in Natchez, Mississippi. Passed St. Francisville, Point Coupee, Port Hudson, Baton Rogue, Iberville, and Placquemine, all in Louisiana. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 4, Page 58 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Monday, Dec. 28, 1835.
text.text: Passed Donaldsonville, Louisiana and the plantation of Mde. Toureau. Arrived in New Orleans. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 4, Page 59 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, Dec. 29, 1835.
text.text: Remained in New Orleans. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 5, Page 78 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, Jan. 19, 1836.
text.text: Left New Orleans for Donaldsonville, Louisiana. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 5, Page 80 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Wednesday, Jan. 20, 1836.
text.text: Passed Donaldsonville, Placquemine, Baton Rogue, Pointe Coupee and St. Francisville, all in Louisiana. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 5, Page 81 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Thursday, Jan. 21, 1836.
text.text: Passed mouth of Atchafalia River and Mississippi River and Groton's Landing in the Parish of Avoyelles. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 5, Page 82 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Friday, Jan. 22, 1836.
text.text: Passed Alexandria, Louisiana. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 5, Page 83 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Saturday, Jan. 23, 1836.
text.text: Arrived in Natchitoches, Louisiana. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 5, Page 85 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, Jan. 26, 1836.
text.text: Arrived in Fort Jesup, Louisiana. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 5, Page 86 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Thursday, Jan. 28, 1836.
text.text: Took Gaines Ferry. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 5, Page 87 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Saturday, Jan. 30, 1836.
text.text: Arrived in San Augustine, Texas. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 5, Page 88 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Sunday, Jan. 31, 1836.
text.text: Arrived in Nacogdoches, Texas. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 6, Page 97 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Monday, Feb. 8, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at McLean's, 18 miles west of Nacogdoches. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 6, Page 99 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, Feb. 9, 1836.
text.text: Rode to Jacob Master's, which was 12 miles away. Arrived at Colin Aldridge's on Caney Creek in what is now Trinity County, Texas. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 6, Page 102 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Wednesday, Feb. 10, 1836.
text.text: Crossed the Trinity, and arrived at Larrison's in what is now Madison County, Texas. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 6, Page 103 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Thursday, Feb. 11, 1836.
text.text: Crossed the Bidais, passed Sims', and arrived at Anderson, Texas. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 6, Page 104 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Friday, Feb. 12, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Boatwright's. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 6, Page 106 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Saturday, Feb. 13, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Washington-on-the-Brazos, Texas. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 6, Page 107 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Sunday, Feb. 14, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Lakey's. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 6, Page 108 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Monday, Feb. 15, 1836.
text.text: Left Lakey's, passed Col. Haden Edward's, and arrived at Cummins' in the afternoon. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 6, Page 109 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, Feb. 16, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at San Felipe de Austin, Texas. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 6, Page 111 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Saturday, Feb. 20, 1836.
text.text: Left Cummins' and rode to Col. Edwards. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 6, Page 115 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Sunday, Feb. 21, 1836.
text.text: Left Col. Edwards', went to visit Harry Davis Gary. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 6, Page 116 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, Feb. 23, 1836.
text.text: Left Gary's, rode to Gideon Walker's, James Walker's, and Washington-on-the-Brazos. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 7, Page 118 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Wednesday, Feb. 24, 1836.
text.text: Left Washington for San Felipe. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 7, Page 118 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Thursday, Feb. 25, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Foster's. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 7, Page 119 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Friday, Feb. 26, 1836.
text.text: Returned to Washington-on-the-River. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 7, Page 124 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Friday, March 18, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Groce's plantation. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 7, Page 136 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Monday, March 21, 1836.
text.text: Left Groce's plantation for Harrisburg, Texas. Stopped at McEarly's. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 8, Page 143 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, March 22, 1836.
text.text: Stopped at Mrs. Burnett's and then arrived at Harrisburg, Texas. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 8, Page 143 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Wednesday, March 23, 1836.
text.text: Stopped at Lorenzo de Zavala's. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 8, Page 145 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Thursday, March 24, 1836.
text.text: Stopped at Earle's. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 8, Page 147 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Friday, March 25, 1836.
text.text: Returned to Harrisburg. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 8, Page 150 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Monday, April 4, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Morgan's. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 8, Page 152 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, April 5, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Clopper's Point, also called New Washington. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 8, Page 153 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Thursday, April 7, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Galveston, Texas. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 8, Page 155 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Saturday, April 9, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Port Bolivar, Texas. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 8, Page 157 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Sunday, April 10, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Clear Creek. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 8, Page 158 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Monday, April 11, 1836.
text.text: Returned to Clopper's Point, also called New Washington. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 8, Page 159 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, April 12, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Routh's. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 8, Page 160 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Wednesday, April 13, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Lynch's (now in Lynchburg, Texas), to take Lynch's Ferry. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 8, Page 163 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Saturday, April 16, 1836.
text.text: Left for Jacob Winfree's. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 163 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Sunday, April 17, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Wallace's (in Wallisville, Texas). Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 164 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Monday, April 18, 1836.
text.text: Passed near Anahuac. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 165 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, April 19, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Williams'. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 166 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Wednesday, April 20, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Grigsby's. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 167 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Thursday, April 21, 1836.
text.text: Arrived in Beaumont, Texas. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 168 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Saturday, April 23, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Ballou's ferry. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 170 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Monday, April 25, 1836.
text.text: Crossed into Louisiana and arrived at Hardy Cowherd's. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 170 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, April 26, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Arsen le Blue Comarsac's. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 171 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Wednesday, April 27, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Bayou Mermentau. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 171 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Thursday, April 28, 1836.
text.text: Left for Vermilion River, arrived at Abshear's, near Nunez, Louisiana. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 172 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Friday, April 29, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at Nunez's, near Perry, Louisiana. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 172 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Saturday, April 30, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at New Iberia, Louisiana. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 173 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Sunday, May 1, 1836.
text.text: Arrived at the house of John D. Wilkins, seven miles from New Iberia. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 174 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Monday, May 2, 1836.
text.text: Left the house of John D. Wilkins, returned to New Iberia. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 174 of the William Fairfax Gray Diary

text.headline: Tuesday, May 3, 1836.
text.text: Visited the houses of Baron Bayard and Dr. Solonge, then arrived in Franklin, Louisiana. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 175

text.headline: Wednesday, May 4, 1836.
text.text: Left Franklin and boarded the steamboat Teche. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 177

text.headline: Thursday, May 5, 1836.
text.text: Arrived in New Orleans at night. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 177

text.headline: Friday, May 6, 1836.
text.text: Remained in New Orleans, stayed at City Hotel. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 178

text.headline: Sunday, May 8, 1836.
text.text: Remained in New Orleans. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 179

text.headline: Thursday, May 12, 1836.
text.text: Remained in New Orleans. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 180

text.headline: Saturday, May 14, 1836.
text.text: Remained in New Orleans. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 180

text.headline: Monday, May 30, 1836.
text.text: Left New Orleans, boarded the steamboat Superior for Vicksburg, Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 185

text.headline: Wednesday, June 1, 1836.
text.text: The Superior passed Post Hudson, Point Coupee, St. Francisville, Tunica Bend, the mouth of the Red River and Fort Adams. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 9, Page 186

text.headline: Thursday, June 2, 1836.
text.text: The Superior passed Natchez, Rodney, and Bruinsburg, all in Mississippi. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 186

text.headline: Friday, June 3, 1836.
text.text: The Superior arrived in Vicksburg, Mississippi at 2am. Gray boarded the Heroine at 11pm. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 186

text.headline: Saturday, June 4, 1836.
text.text: Gray is on board the Heroine. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 187

text.headline: Sunday, June 5, 1836.
text.text: The Heroine passed the mouths of the Arkansaw River and the White River. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 187

text.headline: Monday, June 6, 1836.
text.text: Arrived in Memphis. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 187

text.headline: Tuesday, June 7, 1836.
text.text: Passed through Randolph, Tennessee. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 187

text.headline: Wednesday, June 8, 1836.
text.text: Passed Mill's Point and Paducah, both in Kentucky. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 188

text.headline: Thursday, June 9, 1836.
text.text: Passed Livingston County, Kentucky, Pope County, Illinois, and Cave in Rock, also in Illinois. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 188

text.headline: Friday, June 10, 1836.
text.text: Passed Rockport, Illinois, Troy, Indiana, Cloverport and Stevensport, both in Kentucky, and Rome and Leavensworth, both in Indiana. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 188

text.headline: Saturday, June 11, 1836.
text.text: Arrived in Louisville, Kentucky. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 188

text.headline: Sunday, June 12, 1836.
text.text: Attended an Episcopal service in Louisville. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 189

text.headline: Monday, June 13, 1836.
text.text: Remained in Louisville. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 189

text.headline: Tuesday, June 14, 1836.
text.text: Left Louisville in the steamboat Ben Franklin. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 189

text.headline: Wednesday, June 15, 1836.
text.text: The Ben Franklin reached Cincinnati. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 189

text.headline: Thursday, June 16, 1836.
text.text: Boarded the Detroit, which passed through Maysville, Kentucky, Alexandria and Manchester, both in Ohio, Vanceburg, Kentucky, and Portsmouth, Ohio. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 190

text.headline: Friday, June 17, 1836.
text.text: Passed Guyandotte, West Virginia, Gallipolis, Ohio, and Point Pleasant, West Virginia. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 190

text.headline: Saturday, June 18, 1836.
text.text: Passed Elizabethtown, Virginia (now Moundsville, West Virginia). Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 190

text.headline: Sunday, June 19, 1836.
text.text: Passed Warren, Ohio, Wellsburg, West Virginia, Steubenville, Ohio, Beaver, Pennsylvania, New Philadelphia, Ohio, Freedom, Pennsylvania, and Shaw's Town. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 191

text.headline: Monday, June 20, 1836.
text.text: Arrived in Pittsburgh. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 191

text.headline: Tuesday, June 21, 1836.
text.text: Left Pittsburgh. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 191

text.headline: Wednesday, June 22, 1836.
text.text: Reached Bedford, Pennsylvania by stagecoach. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 192

text.headline: Thursday, June 23, 1836.
text.text: Reached Chambersburg, Pennsylvania by stagecoach. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 192

text.headline: Friday, June 24, 1836.
text.text: Reached Gettysburg, Pennsylvania at 2am and Baltimore at 11pm. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 192

text.headline: Saturday, June 25, 1836.
text.text: Reached Washington DC by noon. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 193

text.headline: Sunday, June 26, 1836.
text.text: Reached Potomac Creek by steamboat, then took a stagecoach for Fredericksburg, Virginia. Read more from this entry.

media.caption: Vol. 10, Page 193
